website_summaries.verdict: The Sigma 150mm F2.8 EX DG OS HSM APO Macro lens is sharp wide open, and it improves dramatically as you close its aperture. It is capable of 1:1 magnification and produces minimal distortion.

customer_reviews.title: OS gave out after two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Exact same as another buyer, so I guess I should’ve read the negative reviews and seen the low average review value for this lens. “After about 90 or so pictures, the OS started cluncking, both when the camera was turned on, and when it was in play. Love the lens otherwise, super sharp, and the OS worked great, for a while. Returned mine. Not crazy about spending another $1000+ to maybe get a lens than works longer than a few weeks.” I returned this to the third party seller, so hopefully they honor the return and don’t play any “stocking fees” games.
customer_reviews.author: EverythingSnob

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens- first time as a macro photographer (usually do birds). At 150 mm , I can get close but still keep a bit of distance from my subject if necessary. IS is very handy as I usually hand-hold. It should be noted that this lens is not 2.8 except at very close range. On the down side, this lens is very noisy. It rattles and whirrs. Not sure if it is a defect- will probably send it to Sigma for evaluation. But have not wanted to part with it long enough to get it checked out. Great 6 year warranty. Not sure you can find the lens for sale anywhere at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: WinterDogWalker

customer_reviews.title: OS issues within 100 shots
customer_reviews.text: After about 90 or so pictures, the OS started cluncking, both when the camera was turned on, and when it was in play. Love the lens otherwise, super sharp, and the OS worked great, for a while. Returned mine. Not crazy about spending another $1000+ to maybe get a lens than works longer than a few weeks.

customer_reviews.title: Great Macro Lens (Sigma 150mm f/2.8 OS lens for Nikon)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for use on a Nikon D300 primarily for extreme close-ups (e.g., small flowers or plants, insects, etc.) and also as a potential portrait lens. I have been using it for a couple of weeks, and it works extremely well for both applications. The OS image stabilization aspect also comes in handy for regular telephoto use or for portraits. I bought this to replace a Tamron 180mm macro lens that did not have image stabilization and it so far has given me the results I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Macro
customer_reviews.text: Razor sharp! The neatest thing is that you can rotate the camera for verticals without having to rotate the whole lens/camera combo thanks to the rotating tripod mount on the lens. This lens has a large focus ring rotation which is very nice for focus-stacking macro shots of flowers. I'm using it with a Nikon D7000 DX body which allows you to back off from the subject and work from a comfortable distance. This also gets you very nice blurred backgrounds for subject isolation - the lens has great bokeh!
customer_reviews.author: TKT

customer_reviews.title: A good macro lens

customer_reviews.title: Its THE best macro lens i have owned for sure.

This is a true 1:1 macro and its sharpness is amazing. I recommend this to anyone looking for a macro over 100mm.

customer_reviews.title: Sigma 150mm macro lens
customer_reviews.text: Truly an incredible lens at a good price point. It replaced both my 105 and 200mm micro lenses with the added benefit of image stabilization. Used mainly manual focus but when activated, the auto focus worked well. Took over 500 pictures with this lens alone on our wildflower mountain expedition. Bit heavy but less than the combined weight of the two lenses it replaced. Feels solid, smooth focus, nice finish and fast. Most importantly, it is tack sharp. No problem interfacing with the Nikon D800 and D810. Probably one of the best lens purchases I have made in years.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Glass!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the AF inside 12 inches or so. Yes, the minimal focus is spec'd at 18 inches. However, I am getting as close as to just under 9 inches and able to focus. AF hunts a lot at that distance, sometimes it hits. MF gets the job done. At normal distances, AF is spot on and fast. Very sharp glass here. Don't be fooled because it doesn't carry Nikon or Canon label. I tested the Canon 100L 2.8 IS macro, and this lens is just as sharp with an increase in focal length.

customer_reviews.title: Erroneous Identification of item for sale
customer_reviews.text: The lens that arrived was not the OS lens that was advertised and I was ready to return it. The seller, not Amazon itself, offered a discounted price and I countered and my offer was accepted. I decided to retain the lens even though it was not the OS model. The lens itself is excellent and I have no complaints. I've used it with a +1 Close-up lens on a tripod with rails, taking pictures of flowers and insects and I'm impressed with the results. But I'm new to Macro so I'm a bit biased. The narrow depth of field is challenging and getting the right shot is time consuming outdoors.

product_meta.title: Sigma 150mm f/2.8 AF APO EX DG OS HSM Macro Lens for Canon Digital SLRs
product_meta.description: Style:Canon Digital SLRsThis latest version of the Sigma Macro 150mm F2.8 EX DG HSM boasts Optical Stabilization (OS) which is critical to equipment sporting this focal range and is now splash-proof. Offering the latest optical design technology this lens remains a large aperture medium macro lens ideal for shooting the smaller things in our world that exists virtually unseen. A macro lens is one which will focus on a subject close enough to render it "life-size" on the image plane in your camera. It also has a "flat" field" front lens element so that it can shoot images of flat objects such as artwork or postage stamps and be tack sharp all the way across the image. With HSM (Hyper-Sonic Motor) a quiet & high-speed auto focus is ensured. It provides extremely high optical performance from infinity to 1:1 Macro. Three SLD (Special Low Dispersion) glass elements provide optimum color correction and sharpness throughout the entire range and Super Multi-layer coating reduces flare and ghosting. It has superior peripheral brightness and provides sharp and high contrast images even at maximum apertures. The OS offers the use of shutter speeds approximately 4 stops slower than would otherwise be possible. It is also compatible with Sigma APO Tele Converters. Ideally suited for taking pictures of insects or other small creatures, but it is also the perfect focal length for facial portraits rendering the best perspective of the human face. This greater distance also allows the photographer more flexibility in lighting the subject with natural light reflectors. So don't miss the tiny insects, flowers of the world or the details in a stamp or coin collection or a piece of embroidery all of which are seldom noticed but offer a fascinating world if you look closely enough. Capture them with the Sigma Macro 150mm F2.8 EX DG OS HSM APO MacroShop all Sigma Lenses here.
